Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not before); LATE PERIOD (not after)
Technique: HEWN; POLISHED; FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; FAYENCE
Name: Necklace with pendants
Description: This necklace, of which the provenance is not known, is composed of tubular beads in faience and of pendants in fayence and cornaline in the form of fish. It dates from the New Kingdom and is provided with an amulet of the Late Period representing Isis, Nephthys and Harpocrates.
